inn1.comm: starts with an outswinger outside off, is left alone
wide outswinger, left alone again
too wide this time, called
unplayable ball. That's too good. Full, middle and off, pitches, then swings away against the angle to beat the edge. Gavaskar would have said you have to be good enough to edge these
short of a length, on off, defended with an open face

got outside the line there. This is too good again. Comes in from outside off after having bowled outswingers all over through. The bat was hidden behind the pad, but even if you consider this a no-shot, the ball wasn't coming back enough
and now he follows a shortish ball outside off, which seams away to beat the edge
full, swinging in, defended to mid-on
another outswinger, too full, though, and defended back to him
low full toss, dug out wide of mid-on for one
swinging in this time, Sharma reads it late, and then clips it late into the leg side
and this one seams the other way. Short of a length, just outside off, Sharma plays the angle, but the ball moves away to beat the edge. Squared up there
short of a length, no movement this time, defended
outswinger, Dhawan has got into a tangle trying to play it to leg. Hits his own pad with the bat
outswinging half-volley, on off, drilled through mid-off for four. Just a touch too full
short of a length, opens the face on it, and a misfield at point allows them the single
short of a length, angling in, tucked away off the hip
throws his bat a wide length ball, it goes off the outside half of the bat, uppishly and wide of point for one
down the leg side, hits his pad, Sanga dives to get a touch to it and saves three leg-byes
length ball outside off, holds its line, Sharma pushes at the angle, and is beaten

short of a length, angling in, beats the inside edge. And he has overstepped. Free hit coming up. I don't think this is a no-ball. He landed behind the line, and slipped. So the third umpire can't change this call?
and the free hit is dispatched. Half-volley, on off, he backs away and smashes it through cover. Could this be the turning point in Rohit's innings?
short of a length, outside off, left alone
Sharma is charging down the wicket, Dilhara digs it in short, and it jumps at his throat. Lucky that it doesn't lob to hand
short of a length, angling in, hits him high on the thigh pad
this one seams back in from wide outside off and cramps him on the cut. Dabbed to second slip
on a length, on middle and off, defended with an open face
down the wicket again, drives this wide of mid-off for one
drives at a wide length ball. No where near the ball, and is beaten as it holds its line
short of a length, on off, steered away to third man
wide length ball, not the driving length by any stretch, but he plays it on the up, and to the left of point. Lokuhettige gets around from third man and makes a diving save
driven on the up again, but this time they have an extra man square on the off side. He does the fielding
short of a length, pushed wide of cover-point for one
bouncer, on the stumps, left alone
slower ball, but short and wide, and Dhawan goes after it, edging it over the slip for four
short of a length, pitched outside leg, tucked away off the hip for one
short of a length, not too wide, gets a bottom edge on the cut
short of a length, angling in, punched back to him
short of a length, no room, played with an open face to cover-point

Dhawan is gone. Dhawan jumps out of the crease again, Mathews bowls an offcutter, shortish, outside leg, Dhawan is nowhere near it but goes ahead with the shot, opening the face and guiding this to slip. Second time this series that Dhawan has been dismissed stepping out this series. Live by the sword, die by it. Also Jayawardene's 200th ODI catch. First to 200
short of a length, outside off, good carry. Left alone
short of a length, wide, left alone
short of a length, wide again, left alone again
fuller, angling in towards off, defended from the crease. A wicket-maiden from Mathews
short of a length, rising towards the chest, dropped to leg for a single
outswinger, and this has started from middle. Too full, though, and nicely defended to mid-on
full, middle and leg, clipped away through midwicket for four
short of a length, outside off, left alone
short of a length, outside off, left alone
angling in from short of a length, left alone
defended with an open face to point
full outside off, left alone
dabbed away to third man for one
full and wide, drives hard at it, gets a thick edge past the slips
short, wide, Sharma doesn't go close to the line of the ball, and is beaten on the cut
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
wide length ball, curving away, left alone
shortish, wide, cuts away from the body, mis-hits it to the right of cover for one
short of a length, wide, good carry, left alone

dropped at point. Jeevan Mendis spills a sitter sitting down at point. Short of a length, outside off, punched in the air, Mendis kneels down at point, gets it face high, goes fingers pointing up, and lets it through
left alone outside off
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
short of a length, outside off, extra bounce, Kohli rises with the ball, plays with soft hands, and drops it well short of slip
steered away, but can't beat the man at that fourth slip
wide length ball, left alone
short of a length, just outside off, right behind it to defend
seams in from outside off, gets the inside edge but avoids the stumps
winded him. Jags back in a long way, and bounces too, and hits him in the rib
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the back foot
short, outside off, Kohli's cut is undone by the away movement. Ends up hitting it back to Malinga
outswinger, on off, defended with an open face
extra bounce. From short of a length, it holds its line and rises towards the chest. Kohli's head falls back as he keeps it down
short of a length, outside off, seams away a little. Defended with an open face
stays short of a length, not much movement this time, punched away to point
length ball, outside off, defended off the front foot
lucky there. Charges at him and edges this drive over slip for one
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
down the wicket, and swings wildly. The extra bounce from a length beats him
length ball, angling in, clipped away to long leg for one
another unplayable delivery. Short of a length, outside off, holds its line against the angle and beats the outside edge
length ball, on off, shapes away, defended from the crease
short of a length, outside off, gets on the top of the bounce, punches, but can't beat point
short of a length, on off, defended to leg
stays a touch low outside off, defended with an open face to point
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg. Sharma wants the single, is sent back

short of a length, outside off, gets some room, and punches it to the right of cover for four. Kohli's first runs off Malinga in the last 12 balls. Today is the first time Malinga has bowled a maiden to Kohli
length ball, angling in, drops and runs, and takes an overthrow too as Mendis runs in from point and misses
this one seams in from outside off and short of a length, takes the inside edge onto the thigh pad. Or maybe it has missed the thigh pad
length ball outside off, leans into the push, and gets a single wide of cover
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
short of a length, just outside off, Kohli stays in the crease to defend to point

edged away wide of second slip. Not quite behind the line of this as he pushes at it, but the edge goes wide of the slips and fine of third man. Herath dives all over it at the boundary. Actually this is steered past the second slip. Not sure how smart that shot was
and starts off with a wide down the leg side
angling in, worked into the leg side for one
short of a length, angling in, pushed towards deep midwicket for one
fuller, angling in again, worked away nicely for another single
short of a length, outside off, guided away to third man for one
short of a length, angling in, defended in front of off
full, angling in, driven to deep cover for one
on a length, angling in, defended off the front foot
full, outside off, pushed to mid-off
short of a length, angling in, worked away to long leg
short of a length, angling in, defended from the crease
short, wide, and despite the extra bounce it has been cut hard between cover-point and point for four
short of a length, gets inside the line of it, and tucks it away to long leg
wide length ball, left alone
short, wide, cut to deep cover for one
steered away to third man for one
length ball, outside off, defended off the front foot
pulled away to deep square leg for one
short of a length, outside off, angling in, worked away for a single
flighted on off, pushed to the left of cover, Kohli wants one but is sent back. Rightly so
full outside off, nicely chipped away over cover for one
short of a length, into the pads, worked around the corner for a couple
slower, higher, but Kohli stays back, waits for it to turn, and then guides it past slip for one
quicker, middle and leg, worked away for an easy single
tossed up, middle and leg, defended back to him
short of a length, angling in, defended back to him
this one stays low from short of a length and outside off. Beats his cut
defended with an open face to point
Sanga hasn't been at his best behind the stumps. Slow to react to one that stays low, and allows one bye
pulled away, fails to keep it down, but it bounces short of the man in the deep. Kohli admonishes himself for that shot
extra bounce for a length ball, which hits Sharma on the forearm. Now he has been hit in the ribs, in the thigh, and the forearm
short, outside off, cut away in front of square for one
full, on off, driven to long-off for one
Kohli is walking, it seems. This is plumb. Misses the length, and goes back to a full ball. To make it worse, this doesn't turn. Skids through, stays low, catches him dead in front
defended off the front foot
aggressive start from Karthik. Too short, too straight, he ricks back and pulls it over midwicket for six
slower through the air, outside off, defended off the front foot
length ball, outside off, defended off the front foot
another one on the glove. Rohit has been beaten black and blue today. Extra bounce from a length, and gets him high
short of a length, outside off, played with an open face, to third man
bouncer, on off, he sways out of its line
short of a length, outside off, defended with an open face
short of a length, outside off, left alone
full, on off, driven to long-off
slow, high, taken on the full, played to midwicket
down the wicket to drive this, but straight to short cover
length ball, on off, flat, defended off the front foot
down the wicket, takes this on the half-volley, gets a single into the leg sid3e
the carrom ball, turns in, beats the inside edge, but is headed down leg, and Sharma has also shimmied down the pitch
short of a length, seaming in, hits him on the knee roll and Karthik is well down the wicket. Can't give that out. Karthik takes a leg-bye
defended to cover
short, seaming in from outside off, and beats Sharma who is charging at him
short of a length, pushed wide of point, and Mendis allows another overthrow. Karthik was in too. Mednis scorecard: one drop, two overthrows
short, too short, and Sharma waits for it and pulls it over mid-on who is up in the circle

that's a Rohit Sharma special. There is a wide slip in place, and he opens the face to guide this short ball there. He has tried his best to get out, but the ball doesn't carry to Jayawardene. Is this the luck Sharma needs? He has actually hit Jayawardene on the thumb, and he is off the ground
full, on off, driven to long-off for one
full, middle and leg, straightens a touch. Back to the bowler
flatter, on off, defended
Sharma has picked the carrom ball, and goes with the turn and over deep midwicket. This is full, but he has slog-swept it powerfully
short of a length, middle and leg, worked into the leg side for one
tossed up, on off, defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, stays low. Kept out. No ball from Lokuhettige. Following in the proud Dilhara tradition of Dilhara Fernando
the free hit is a full toss, but he has hit it to deep square for just one
short of a length, walks down to work this to leg for one
seams in but too straight, and is worked around the corner for one
short of a length, on off, defended to leg. The soft hands allow him a single
wide length ball, left alone
wide length ball again, he defends with an open face to point
tossed up on the pads, dropped into the leg side for a single
nicely played. The ball turns from just outside off, he plays with soft hands, and opens the face a touch. Gets a single towards third man
flatter, outside off, pushed to deep cover
extra effort on this... good revs... gets turn and bounce, and beats Rohit's attempt to play it to off
flat outside off, Sharma goes back to back-cut it past short third man. Chandimal gives chase, and has presumed this will be just two, but Karthik has stunned him by taking the third

lovely delivery. Karthik is stunned. Should have possibly played forward. Lots of revs and effort in this, pitches on a length, on middle and off. Karthik stays back in defence, the ball turns appreciably, beats the outside edge, and hits the off stump
too full, too straight, gets a single to short fine leg
legbreak, wide, left alone
another legbreak, defended outside off
swept away from middle-and-leg line for a single
legbreak, hits him in front of leg, so it has to be pitching outside leg, but Sri Lanka appeal and have been told no they are wrong
full toss outside leg, beaten on the sweep. Called a wide
short legbreak, stays low, and is straight too. Well done by Raina to keep it out with the toe end of the bat
Raina tries to throw his wicket now. Charges at him and lofts him towards deep midwicket. Lucky that it has bounced short
extra bounce on this offbreak, hits the high part of the defensive bat
down the wicket to reach the pitch of the ball and drive this to long-on
flat, on a length, defended back to him
shimmies down again, is beaten in the flight, plays the half-sweep to deep square for one
short of a length, Sharma is a little late on the cut, and is beaten

inn2.comm: starts with a really full delivery, which is kept out
short of a length, just outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, left alone
fuller, closer to off, makes him play. Then the ball seams away a little to beat his edge
wide length ball, Tharanga drives without any feet. Beaten
short of a length, just outside off, punched away to third man for one
swinging full toss, hits the pad, goes past Karthik. Four leg-byes
lovely shot. Half-volley, outside off, almost flicked over extra cover. Nice little chip
short of a length, middle and leg, defended to leg
tucked away off the hip
lovely shot again. This is short and wide, Jayawardene gets on the top of the bounce, and cuts it to the left of point and the right of third man
he has got away with this one. Too straight, and all Jayawardene needs is a deflection down leg, but the extra bounce means he is hit in the thigh pad

Bhuvneshwar strikes in his first spell again. It is incredible how many times he does that. Short of a length, just outside off, Tharanga follows it a little lazily. The ball gets a good lift, takes the edge, and Raina at second slip is wider than usual. And you know what, the ball has found Raina as if it were the bull's eye

Bhuvneshwar on a hat-trick. Sanga seems to have got a shocker from umpire Nero. He is not pleased with this one. This is short of a length, and has hit him over the knee roll on the back pad. Also there is a doubt whether it pitched within the stumps. Waiting for the replay now. Replays confirm my doubts: pitched outside leg, and bouncing over the stumps. Sanga has indeed got a shocker
nearly the hat-trick. Too good to get that hat-trick. This one is short of a length, just outside off, Chandi plays the angle, but it seams away to beat the edge
length ball, into the pads, defended to mid-on
leg-side half-volley, and Chandi just pushes it straight to mid-on. That's what two early wickets do to you
short of a length, wide, placed wide of the diving point for one
Yadav starts his second over with a wide outside off
another wide. Short and too far outside off

out of nowhere Yadav delivers a brute. This length ball seams back in and bounces extra and then hits the right elbow. Chandi is in pain. In the previous match, too, he got a brutish seaming delivery that bowled him. This one has left him with a swollen forearm
short of a length, on the stumps, defended from the crease
short of a length, just outside off. Good carry. Left alone
quick length ball, 143ks, hits the top of his defensive bat
short of a length, rising into the ribs, defended towards mid-on
another brute. Quick, on a length, seaming in, beats the inside edge, but is headed down leg when it hits the pad
short of a length, outside off, holds its line, stays low, beats the outside edge
again a shortish delivery seams away, but this one bounces extra too. Beaten again
Jayawardene walks down the wicket to negate the movement, but still short of the pitch of the ball and it moves away to beat the outside edge
this one moves in, too straight, and is tucked away for one
wide length ball, even though it seams back in Chandi doesn't nee dot play at it

another unplayable delivery. This ball is doing crazy things. This is headed in for all money, pitches just in front of off, and Chandi has to play it. However, upon pitching it deviates away, and beats the outside edge. Unplayable
the rare loose ball. Shortish, too wide, and Jayawardene punches it wide of diving point. The ball slows down in the wet outfield, and Ishant Sharma nearly slips while fielding from third man
quick, stays low, but too straight, and Jayawardene guides it away for a single to square leg
short of a length, just outside off, dabbed away to point
lovely shot. Punched on the up, away from the body, but timed sweetly and placed past point. It's just the damp outfield that has kept this down to two
unplayable. Too much seam. Length ball, angling into off and middle, and then seams away after pitching. Beaten again

this one seams the other way. This pitch has become too difficult to bat on, and India are exploiting those regions of moisture. From almost the same spot as the previous ball this one seams in and hits him high on the pads. The extra bounce seems to have saved him

too full, too straight, clipped past the diving mid-on where Ishant Sharma is a little too slow to dive. The slow outfield is at work again. Keeps the ball in, and Jadeja's rocket throw from the boundary nearly surprises Jayawardene who is taking the third
beaten again. This one seams away from just outside off
this one seams the other way, and Chandi just about gets the inside edge
short of a length, into the pads, nicely pushed wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, sticks in the surface. Jayawardene wants to leave it, but then thinks it is too close to him, and plays it with soft hands

Bhuvneshwar has three. And this is a huge wicket. Of the man who is best placed to counter these conditions. Jayawardene tries a calculated risk, but he has calculated wrong. Backs away to make room and cut, and at no point makes an effort to keep it down. However, the ball bounces a touch extra, and goes much finer and much further than Jayawardene wants it to go. A sitter for third man
starts on target. Short of a length, just outside off, the ball seams in, bounces extra, hits the inside edge onto the thigh pad
stays short of a length, into the pads, flicked away to square leg
too full.  A half-volley almost. The field is attacking and there is no mid-off. Nicely push-driven through that region
this is better. Slightly short of a length, outside off, Chandi pushes at it, and the away movements beats the edge
short of a length, angling in, defended to mid-on
length ball, just outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, on off, defended back to him
short of a length, just outside off, punched to point

Bhuvneshwar is close to getting a five-for in a 26-over game. Thirimanne too takes a risk, and it is not an outlandish risk. He backs away a little to try and go through the covers. Takes this length ball from outside leg, and times it very nicely, but he has neither got the elevation nor has he missed the fielder. Finds Kohli at cover to perfection
wide length ball, the ball holds its line, Mathews pushes at it tentatively, and is beaten
short of a length, outside off, beaten again as it holds its line
beaten again. Mathews is tentatively pushing at balls outside off, and the balls are seaming away to hold their line
length ball, angling in, beats the inside edge, and hits him high on the thigh
short of a length, extra bounce, seam movement back in, hits him high on the thigh pad
short of a length, into the ribs, nicely rides the bounce and tucks it away for a single

that wide second slip got them a wicket earlier, but it has now cost them four. Mathews is tentative again, and follows a shortish ball, edges it, and second slip would have swallowed it. Raina watches it from the fourth slip area
Mathews tries to break free. His first shot of conviction. Jumps out of the crease, turns this into a length ball, and lofts it over extra cover for four
and he gives Sharma the charge again, Sharma bowls it shorter, and also gets some movement to cut him into two. The ball goes between the leg stump and Mathews, and Karthik has to make a diving save
and more seam movement. Wide length ball, holds its line, and beats him
short of a length, closer to off, pushed to cover

the inside edge? No it is seaming too much, according to the umpire. It looks dead plumb live time. Seaming in from short of a length, staying low, hitting him in front of middle and leg, but for some reason BK's appeal is soft, and he doesn't get the decision. This looked plumber, much plumber, than Sanga's call
left alone outside off
another leave outside off as this holds its line
length ball, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
full, middle and leg, played back to Jadeja
full again, on off, driven down the ground for one
slower, higher, on a length outside off, and turns and bounces to beat him
pushed wide of cover for one
short of a length, outside off, defended off the front foot
short, wide, cut away wide of deep cover for two
short offbreak, tucked away to short fine leg
swept away from outside off, to deep square leg
swept. It's too short for the sweep, but Chandi has taken the risk because the square leg is in the circle. The mis-hit travels between square leg and short fine leg
oh ho ho. What a beautiful shot. Dances down in a jiffy, and goes inside-out over cover. That is timed so well it has gone into the second tier
short of a length, into the pads, defended
full, on off, pushed towards long-off for one
sharp turn outside off, beats Chandimal's tentative push
too straight, middle and leg, defended to leg
full, on off, driven, but Kohli makes a diving save at cover
short of a length, goes back to cover the turn, and cuts, but can't beat point
arm ball, quicker, angling in, Chandimal plays with an open face to get a single past cover

second grab, but that will do. Too good again. Quick, flat, on off, has to play at it, but the ball still turns. The moisture is making the ball do a lot of things here. And then it takes the edge, and it bounces extra too, which is evident from how it has hit the top of Karthik's glove. He recovers well to take the ricochet
carrom ball, starts outside leg, pushed towards cover, and they go through for one. Dhawan hits a direct-hit, but Chandi is in
full, outside leg, swept away, but can't beat short fine leg
short of a length, pitched outside leg, defended to mid-off
carrom ball, pitched outside leg, defended back to him
short of a length, pushed wide of point for a single
quicker, flat, into the pads, clipped away for a single
and Mendis tries the reverse sweep, into Karthik's pads and then takes the single off the ricochet
slows it down. flights it, Chandi tries the slog sweep, and is beaten by the big turn
quicker, flatter, still turning, hits the outside half of the bat, gets them a single wide of point
flat, into the pads, pushed to midwicket. Kohli seems to have twisted his lower back. The wet outfield there again. That foot got stuck as he tried to field
down the wicket to push this to long-off for one

wild wild shot. How do you explain this? Jadeja is bowling quick darts that are turning a long way. How can you even think of dancing down the wicket to him and slog away like there is no tomorrow? Chandi does just that, and is stumped by a mile. Was never behind the line of the ball. He would have been stumped even if the ball had not turned. West Indies won't enjoy watching this shot. India will relish it
short of a length, outside off, left alone
left alone outside off again
that's a top shot. Mendis goes across to get behind the line of this length ball, and smashes this one the up, between the stumps and mid-off
short of a length, outside off, angling away, beats the bat as Mendis follows it
bouncer, too high, called wide
short of a length, outside off, punched away to deep cover for one
down the leg side, but he lucky that it has kissed the pad on the way
down the wicket to defend
gets across the line to sweep this and BK makes a footed save at deep square leg. That on a soft outfield can cause injuries
swept away again, gets a single
length ball, holds its line, defended back to him
tossed up outside off, defended to cover
tries the slog sweep, mis-hits it to deep square for one
carrom ball, pitched outside leg, allows it to hit the pad
short of a length, outside leg, worked away to leg for one
full and down the leg side, paddled away fine for a couple. Actually leg-byes
short of a length, worked into the leg side for a single
full, outside leg, worked away for a single
timber. Yorker, squeezes under Mendis's bat, takes the toe end actually, and bounces into the middle stump. Almost sure of a repeat of this match-up in the final
length ball outside off, pushed to deep cover for one
length ball, quick, Herath looks to sweep, gets a top sweep over backward short leg
wide down the leg side
quick, flat, defended off the front foot
looks to sweep a fast delivery, the ball hits the back of the bat and lobs over slip
tossed up on off, defended off the front foot
tries the slog sweep, is nowhere near the pitch of the ball. Beaten. Jadeja has bowled out for 5-0-17-2
quick delivery, hits the pa, but is going down leg
swept away to deep midwicket for one
carrom ball, defended in front of leg
down the wicket, the ball is short and straight, and he ends up hitting it to cover
googly? Or some variation it was. Short, gets extra bounce, and turns into the pads. Can't beat short fine leg
tossed up outside leg, beats the reverse-sweep
it doesn't seem we will need those five over. Short, outside off, Herath's pull is limp, and an easy catch towards mid-off
short of a length, straight, defended back to him
short, wide, beaten on the cut
on a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, just outside off, holds its line to beat the bat
tossed up on off, defended
full, just outside off, driven to long-off for one
sharp offbreak, turns down leg, called a wide
flat length ball, defended off the back foot
short of a length, outside off, defended
flighted outside off, defended to mid-off
slower in the air, high, defended back to him
bouncer, just outside off, beats the pull

another wicket. Short of a length, bowled cross seam, which gets him the extras bounce, goes off the shoulder of the bat for a soft one-handed take to Karthik who is held in a warm embrace by second slip, Raina
short of a length, outside off, somehow - while backing away - he gets a single to third man
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
goes for the big hit down the ground, mis-hits it straight of mid-on for a couple
bouncer, on middle and off, beats the pull again
short of a length, outside off, beats the outside edge
Malinga backs away and flick-pulls a shortish ball over mid-on
Malinga swings again, and the top edge clears the infield. Jadeja going after it for the catch nearly twists his ankle on the soft outfield
slower ball, all over. Mainga hits this clean, but Jadeja leaps at mid-on to take the catch
